text.__SUMMARY__: Stylidium rupestre is a dicotyledonous plant that belongs to the genus Stylidium (family Stylidiaceae), a species sometimes named as the rock triggerplant. It is found in Southwest Australia. The species was first described by Otto Wilhelm Sonder.
text.References: "Stylidium rupestre Sond. f. rupestre". Australian Plant Name Index (APNI), IBIS database. Centre for Plant Biodiversity Research, Australian Government.
